answers.answer: Hi,There are many reasons which can cause your symptoms.Please consult your GP befor you could consult your ortho specialist.Do a blood work and see if you are diabetic.Goodluck

Does it affect both hands? Any other symptoms? The pain and numbness on your fingers are non-specific symptoms and could be due to a number of conditions such as neuropathy, diabetes, arthritis, raynaud's disease, cervical spondylisis, etc.  Consult a physician at the earliest possible time.

question: Hi- please help. what causes pain,prickly numbness in fingers. sometimes they ache and itch also. My ankle twist sometimes and I fall or almost fall. Please help me figure these problems out Thanks
title: numbness,prickly,itchy hands
